name: As Samad
description: As Samad is one of the names of Allah in Islam, which translates to 'The Eternal' or 'The Absolute.' It refers to Allah's self-sufficiency and the idea that He is in need of nothing and that everything relies on Him.
summary: The name As Samad originates from the Quran, specifically from Surah Al-Ikhlas (Chapter 112), which emphasizes the unique oneness and eternal nature of Allah. It is a reminder of God's independence and the source of all sustenance and existence.
